Investition.title: Investing in Real Estate in Dubai
Investition.subtitle:
The Dubai real estate market is showing stable growth, including villas and townhouses, with a 25% increase in prices over the past few years. These properties maintain a high income potential, especially in prestigious areas.

Apartments and studios have risen by 40%, but larger properties continue to be profitable for investors. At the same time, such properties attract steady demand and provide opportunities for capitalization.

Additionally, Dubai is advantageous in terms of tax conditions — there are no taxes on rental income and capital gains, making it attractive for long-term investments.

Consalting.title: Business in the UAE: How to open a company in Dubai
Consalting.subtitle: Registering a company in Dubai opens up a range of strategic advantages that can significantly improve your business efficiency. The UAE offers a unique opportunity for foreign entrepreneurs, providing low tax rates, a stable economy, and access to international markets.

Banner.title: Real Estate Investment in the UAE
Banner.subtitle: The key to financial success and long-term stability

invest.title: Global imkoniyatlarga yo'l oching.
invest.subtitle: Dubai is not just a city, it is the financial center of the future. Tax benefits, a stable currency, unique opportunities for long-term investments, and rising real estate prices make this market one of the most attractive in the world. By investing in property here, you are not just purchasing square meters, but gaining access to one of the most dynamic and profitable markets.
invest.text-1: No income or property tax for investors
invest.text-2: Rising real estate prices, high rental yields
invest.text-3: Access to international markets and investments
invest.text-4: Transparent legislation and protection of property owners' rights

Consalting.title: Golden Visa in the UAE: How to optimize taxes
Consalting.subtitle: Registering a company in Dubai is an opportunity to take your business to the next level. Low taxes, stable currency, and access to the world’s largest markets create ideal conditions for growth. The UAE offers unique advantages for foreign entrepreneurs: no corporate taxes, fast registration, and professional support at every step. Open a business in one of the free zones and get all the necessary tools for successful international expansion.

Scheme.title: Real Estate Purchase Process
Scheme.text-1-subtitle: You can select a property remotely or in person by visiting Dubai. We will provide offers from our own database of properties from trusted developers.
Scheme.text-2: Request for the sale and purchase agreement from the developer
Scheme.text-2-subtitle: After selecting the property, the process of paying the booking fee and awaiting the sale and purchase agreement (SPA) from the developer begins.
Scheme.text-3: Payment of the first installment – down payment
Scheme.text-3-subtitle: The amount of the first installment depends on the payment plan of the specific development and is usually 10 or 20% of the property value.
Scheme.text-4-subtitle: Once all the documents are in place, registration takes about one day. After that, the buyer receives the Title Deed (proof of ownership).

PopularReviews.title: Frequently Asked Questions
PopularReviews.faq_question_1: Can a foreigner buy property in Dubai?
PopularReviews.faq_answer_1: Yes, foreigners can buy property in Dubai, but only in certain areas where property ownership is allowed for foreign investors. These are typically prestigious areas with highly developed infrastructure and amenities.
PopularReviews.faq_answer_2: Foreigners can buy property in freehold areas, such as Dubai Marina, Palm Jumeirah, Downtown Dubai, Business Bay, Jumeirah Beach Residence (JBR), and other popular areas. These zones are designated for investors, including foreign nationals.
PopularReviews.faq_question_3: What types of property are available for purchase?
PopularReviews.faq_answer_3: Foreigners can purchase various types of properties, including apartments, villas, townhouses, and commercial properties (offices, shops, and warehouses). Villas and apartments are especially popular for long-term living and renting out.
PopularReviews.faq_question_4: What is the cost of property in Dubai?
PopularReviews.faq_answer_4: Property prices in Dubai vary widely depending on the area, type of property, and its condition. For example, the average cost of an apartment can start from 700,000 AED for small apartments in less expensive areas, to several million dirhams for luxury properties in premium locations such as Palm Jumeirah or Downtown Dubai.
PopularReviews.faq_answer_5: Yes, foreigners can obtain a mortgage in Dubai, but the terms depend on the type of residency. For non-residents, an initial payment of 40% is usually required, while for UAE residents, it is 20-30%. Mortgage terms may vary depending on the bank, but generally, mortgages are offered for up to 25 years.
PopularReviews.faq_question_6: What are the property taxes in Dubai?
PopularReviews.faq_answer_6: There is no property tax in Dubai, but a government fee of 4% of the property value is charged when purchasing property. Additional costs may include registration fees, processing costs, and legal services.

NewBuildingsMarket.title: New Buildings Market in Tashkent
NewBuildingsMarket.text-1: The new buildings market in Tashkent is actively developing and attracting both local and foreign investors. New residential complexes are being built in Tashkent, offering a variety of options, from small apartments to luxury penthouses. These projects often include modern amenities such as fitness centers and playgrounds.
NewBuildingsMarket.text-2: Prices for new buildings vary depending on the district and housing class, making the market attractive for investment. New residential complexes often include developed infrastructure, including shopping centers, schools, and medical facilities, making life in such complexes more convenient.

NewBuildingsMarketDubai.title: New Buildings Market in Dubai
NewBuildingsMarketDubai.text-1: The new buildings market in Dubai is rapidly developing and offers buyers a wide range of modern real estate. You can find both luxury apartments with stunning views of the city and the Persian Gulf, as well as cozy family residences in peaceful residential areas.
NewBuildingsMarketDubai.text-2: New buildings in Dubai are distinguished by innovative technologies, luxurious architecture, and developed infrastructure. Thanks to government support and flexible payment conditions, purchasing real estate in Dubai has become the most attractive option for investors.

CookieConsent.title: We have placed cookies on your device to help make this website better. By continuing, you agree to our

CookieConsent_page.title: Cookie Policy
CookieConsent_page.intro: This Cookie Policy describes the use of cookies on this website. By using our website, you agree to the use of cookies as described in this policy.

section1.title: 1. What are Cookies?
section1.text: Cookies are small files stored on a user’s computer that contain data related to a specific website. These files are placed on the user’s computer by the website and accessed each time the user browses it. Cookies are widely used to make websites work efficiently and provide information to website owners. Cookies used by us are harmless.

section2.title: 2. When and why does Danube Properties use Cookies?
section2.text: We place Cookies on any browser visiting our sites. This helps us to provide you with a good experience when you browse our website and allows us to improve our site. [By continuing to browse the site, you are agreeing to our use of cookies.] Cookies help us understand which parts of the site are being used, user navigation, and preferred interactions. This Policy outlines the Cookies used by us, providing you with the option to opt-out if you choose.

essential.title: Essential Cookies:
essential.description: Necessary for the website to function properly.

analytical.title: Analytical/Performance Cookies:
analytical.description: Help us understand how visitors interact with the website, enabling us to improve its performance.

functionality.title: Functionality Cookies:
functionality.description: Enhance user experience by remembering preferences.

browserSettings.title: Browser Settings:
browserSettings.description: You can choose to accept or decline Cookies through your browser settings. Refer to your browser’s help menu for instructions.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies:
thirdParty.description: We may use third-party services that may place Cookies on your device. Third-party Cookies are subject to the respective privacy policies of their providers.

session.title: Session Cookies:
session.description: Temporary Cookies that are deleted when you close your browser.

persistent.title: Persistent Cookies:
persistent.description: Remain on your device for a set period or until manually deleted.

doubleClick.title: DoubleClick Cookies:
doubleClick.description: We may use Cookies for ad serving via Google’s DoubleClick ad server. These cookies serve ads tailored to user interests based on browsing history, ensuring ‘interest-based targeting.’

advertising.title: Cookies for Advertising:
advertising.description: Cookies and ad technologies help us serve relevant ads effectively. They also aid in providing aggregated auditing, research, and reporting for advertisers.

section6.title: 6. Local Storage
section6.text: Apart from Cookies, local storage uses a small portion of your machine to store information, enhancing your site journey by remembering previous actions persistently.

section7.title: 7. Changes to this Policy
section7.text: We reserve the right to update this Cookie Policy. Changes are effective when posted on the website.

section8.title: 8. Contact Us:
section8.text: For any questions regarding this Cookie Policy, contact us at
